title: Bug 6410: File is unchanged but dirtied by code assist
description: When using code assist in a Java file, the file is being marked as dirty even though no changes have been made.
OB: Upon using code assist by pressing CtrlSpace inside the leftmost parenthesis of a method call, the Java file is marked as dirty.
EB: The Java file should not be marked as dirty after using code assist if no changes have been made.
SR:
1. Open a Java file.
2. Place the cursor inside the leftmost parenthesis of a method call.
3. For example, consider 'I' to be the cursor below:
   Object o = anotherObject.method(I);
4. Press CtrlSpace to trigger code assist.
